recipe.name: Mixed-Cheese Quiche
recipe.description: A versatile and delicious quiche that transforms leftover cheese scraps into an easy, elegant dish. This recipe combines various cheeses with a simple egg and milk custard, baked in a flaky pie crust until golden and bubbly.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Assorted soft or semi-soft cheeses (e.g., Cheddar, Gruyère, Fontina, goat cheese, Gorgonzola), rinds removed and cut into chunks

steps: Roll out the pie dough and fit it into a 9-inch pie dish. Trim any excess dough and crimp the edges as desired.

Blind bake the crust: Line the pie shell with parchment paper or aluminum foil and fill with pie weights or dried beans. Bake for 15 minutes, then remove the weights and lining, and bake for an additional 5 minutes until the crust is lightly golden. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly.
Spread the assorted cheese chunks evenly over the bottom of the pre-baked pie crust.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and nutmeg (if using) until well combined.
Pour the egg mixture over the cheese in the pie crust, ensuring the cheese is evenly covered.
Bake the quiche in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the custard is set and the top is golden brown.
Allow the quiche to cool for at least 10 minutes before slicing and serving. It can be enjoyed warm or at room temperature.
